intro: [WRONG START] Moonoon tsukayae, commonly known as the Japanese moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its nocturnal blooming habit makes it a unique and attractive species for botanical study.
